intro: Rudgea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. Rudgea angustifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
